result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles V Donnell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 123 days time served.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers. No alcohol or controlled substances.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program. Successfully complete a Parenting Program.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 5/12/17; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment. Restitution set at zero.

Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 5/12/17; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING  (18 pages) commencing MAY 12, 2014 received and filed.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of GUILTY PLEA HEARING  commencing MARCH 7, 2014  received and filed. (19 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to  Gregory Renden - SPD  819 N 6th Street  #908  Milwaukee, WI  53203.

Defendant Charles V Donnell in court with attorney Benjamin T Van Severen.  Defendant Charles V Donnell in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Count 1:
Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 36 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 123 days.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 05/12/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 05/12/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Employment or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Successfully complete a Parenting Program
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Attorney Benjamin T Van Severen in court, defendant Charles V Donnell not in court, in custody.  Laura A Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Denis Stingl.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for sentencing hearing today.  Court grants the joint request for an adjournment.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Charles V Donnell in court with attorney Benjamin T. Van Severen.  Defendant Charles V Donnell in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
AS TO COUNT 1:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.
AS TO COUNT 2:
  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered Count 2 DISMISSED and READ IN. Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess and firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored. Case calendared for SENTENCING on 4/30/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Attorney Benjamin T. Van Severen in court, defendant Charles V Donnell not in court, in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 15.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 03-07-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Charles V Donnell in court with attorney Benjamin T. Van Severen.  Defendant Charles V Donnell in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Chad Boyack-MPD Officer.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Charles V Donnell
Current: 8947 N 96TH ST, Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 01-12-2014)
Prior: 4540 North Teutonia Avenue #4, Milwaukee, WI 53209

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring with DRUG TESTING, BREATHALYZER TESTS AND ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Charles V Donnell in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Charles V Donnell in custody.  Nicholas S. Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant pled not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNT 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WATTS, Branch 15.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
